info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:23PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County, including Page and southern portions of Lake Powell through 515 PM MDT/415 PM MST/... At 422 PM MDT/322 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Marble Canyon, or 12 miles south of Page, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, LeChee, Lees Ferry, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Wahweap, Antelope Creek Basin, Lake Powell, Antelope Canyon and Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 527 and 553. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 528 and 537. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
